page.title: 02Education in Walberton
page.content: In the block are two state village schools _ Walberton and Binsted C.of E. Primary School and Slindon Primary School. There is also a Nursery School on the Walberton site which takes 24 pre_school children four mornings a week. This school has a waiting list. The Walberton school in the last eight years has seen its numbers vary from 160+ to less than 120, due to a national fall in birthrate, then back to 170+ by 1986. The recovery is not due to a sudden fertility rise in the village but because of a recent influx of children from outside the village as the school is enjoying a good reputation locally. Its strengths are its academic standards, music teaching, drama performances, computer use and particularly involvement of parents.
